alert.note: Alert for Anchorage (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 10 at 6:32AM AKST until December 11 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 6 AM AKST MONDAY... * WHAT...Blowing snow expected. North winds gusting as high as 40 mph for north and west Anchorage. Easterly winds gusting as high as 65 mph across the Anchorage Hillside tonight. Visibility reduced to as low as one half mile. * WHERE...Anchorage. * WHEN...From noon today to 6 AM AKST Monday. * IMPACTS...Plan on hazardous travel. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday morning commute. Strong winds could cause tree damage and power outages. Strong winds could cause significant drifting of snow on area roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Gusty north winds will develop across north and west Anchorage by midday today and intensify into the evening and overnight hours before diminishing early Monday morning. The strong winds will lift easily transportable snow already on the ground leading to significant drifting and blowing snow.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
